segments.text: What time is it?  They're supposed to run around midnight.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: This is great, isn't it?  Look at the night we've got here, couldn't be better.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I would have liked to have gone a little further up the coast to get away from the lights and the people, but I was afraid we'd miss it.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: How you doing?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Fine.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Is that--no--is that just foam?  I can't even tell.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, I guess we can tell, it probably isn't right?  Probably be unmistakable don't you think?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: How you doing?  Aw, you know what I forgot?  I forgot to bring my flashlight.  Oh, how could I be so stupid?  I should've brought my flashlight.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What flashlight?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You know, the flashlight, the silver one.  There's only one isn't there?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That's not your flashlight.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Who's is it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's ours.  It's mine too.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, well sure.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You kept saying my flashlight, if as if somehow it's just yours.  I mean is that supposed to make me feel?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Right, of course.  Our flashlight.  Mine and yours.  I mean, me flashlight is su flashlight naturally.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: How could we forget to bring it?  I hope the moon stays out.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I wonder, do they always run during a full moon?  I can't remember if it was full last year.  Do you remember?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You cold?  Do you want my jacket?  Oh, we should've brought the blanket.  Our blanket.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: This is great, isn't it?  A six pack would be just the ticket right now.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I can't believe I forgot.  I'm like a kid.  It's amazing I got out of the house with my fly zipped.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You think they can hear us talk?  Or feel the vibrations in the sand when we move around?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm cold.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Do you want my jacket?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's after eleven, let's just go home.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Are you kidding?  We'd miss it.  We just got here.  What's the point of coming down here if we just turn around and go home.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There is no point in coming down here.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Right.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That's my point.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's my point too.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: So, let's go.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No. No. That's not my point.  The point is there's no point in coming down if we just leave.  Don't you want to see it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not particularly.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why not?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I just don't.  It's stupid.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Honey, this is a natural phenomenon.  I mean this only happens once a year, you know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Think about the people in Kansas, they had to get plane tickets and hotel reservations to see this.  We live forty minutes away.  It's too good to pass up.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Pass up what?  These little fish swim onto the beach, they flop around, and swim away.  And then they die.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah, but that moment on the beach, is the highlight of their little lives.  All that flopping is laying eggs or what do you--spawning or mating.  I mean,
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: this is a big night for these guys.  Life's last orgy.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What are you so excited about?  I mean, it's not a moon landing we're talking about here.  It's fish.  It's a fish nobody even eats.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah they do.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Ah, Augie.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Alright.  But it's fish that do something that none of the other fish do.  Like the swallows returning to Capistrano or the lemmings throwing themselves off the cliffs.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There's--there's a bit of the magic--some unexplainable here.  I don't see how you can not be interested.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm just not.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: For real?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't get it.  The first time we came here, you said it was the best night of your life.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And last year, I remember specifically you were so excited to go that you stubbed your toe rushing me out of the house and didn't even notice until we got in the car.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Last year, you will also remember our shoes got wet, I got sand in my panties, you got a sore throat, we got in a big fight over nothing, and we didn't see the grunions.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We weren't in a good spot.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: We didn't see them the first time either.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We just weren't in a good spot.  This is a much better spot.  Believe me, I've got good instincts for these things.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There is that--no that's just seaweed isn't it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh man, this is great, isn't it?  I wouldn't miss this for anything.  Here, think about this, all right, I know you're not interested, but think about this.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Somewhere out there, this huge mass of silver fish swimming this way.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They don't know why, we don't know why.  Nobody sent them an invitation or a map, it wasn't a decision, just-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: all as one, this time release instinctual little firecracker went off and they all turned and formed a line as long as the California coast and started swimming.  And they're swimming right now as if that's all that matters.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's like single mindedness with no mind.  It's urgency that's pure urge.  They don't know what drives them.  They don't ask it a question or give it a name.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They just turn as one and start the swim that brings them right here to where we stand, for a massive celebration of sex and death.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Ah, God, I'm giving myself goose bumps.  Look, all my hairs are popped up.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That's the wind.
